channel.title: Movie Thread
channel.description:
Yes I know this is similar to the "last movie you watched" thread, but I thought it was different enough to warrant it's own thread. What are some movies you've really liked and what do you recommend? Include your favorite genres so others will know if they might have similar tastes.
I really like comedies, kinda like dramas, some Black and White, and a fair amount of action. I am not at all a fan of family movies. They make me want to puke.
[url='https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0050083/']12 Angry Men[/url] [url='https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0167404/']The Sixth Sense[/url] [url='https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0450259/']Blood Diamond[/url] [url='https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0095016/']Die Hard[/url] [url='https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0936501/']Taken[/url] [url='https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0109040/']Ace Ventura[/url] [url='https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0427152/']Dinner for Shmucks[/url] [url='https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0245686/']Joe Dirt[/url] [url='https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0392878/']The Onion Movie[/url] [url='https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0110912/']Pulp Fiction[/url] [url='https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0120382/']The Truman Show[/url] [url='https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0387808/']Idiocracy[/url] [url='https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0289879/']The Butterfly Effect[/url] [url='https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0102926/']The Silence of the Lambs[/url]
And I think that's about it for my favorites. The Truman Show The Onion Movie and Dinner for Shmucks are my two favorites out of all those.

jethrosoup:

I know this is blasphemy, or whatever, but I could never get into LotR.

Many people say it’s boring and I get where they come from - so you’re not so special.

item.title: Movie Thread
item.dc:creator: OldDirtyBastard
item.description:
it was way too hard to follow.

Guess what? I was 14-15 When I first got the book.
I ended up returning to the very beginning for at least 5 times. I made it my bitch though in the end, with tremendous effort.

Read full topic

item.title: Movie Thread
item.dc:creator: Imonfire
item.description:
acade366:

ever tried reading the books?

I did, and really enjoyed them. Same thing with The Hobbit. I tried to read The Silmarillion though, but I gave up after fifty pages because it was way too hard to follow.

item.title: Movie Thread
item.dc:creator: andx0r
item.description:
Glancing over to my movie shelf and picking out my favorites…

The Blues Brothers
The Road Warrior
Back to the Future trilogy
Office Space
12 Angry Men
Clerks
Mean Streets
Monty Python and the Holy Grail
Ronin
The Dirty Dozen
Trading Places
Ghostbusters
GoodFellas
Die Hard
Spirited Away
Beauty and the Beast
Three Kings
When Harry Met Sally
Friday
Tangled
Point Blank
When We Were Kings
Star Wars IV-VI
Knocked Up
Lethal Weapon 1-4
The Corpse Bride
The Big Lebowski

Yeah. I’m not much for indie movies and obscure ones. Sue me.

Read full topic
